trans-unit.source: How to Scale Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to Scale Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Learn how to scale your Azure Redis Cache instances
trans-unit.target: Learn how to scale your Azure Redis Cache instances

trans-unit.source: How to Scale Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: How to Scale Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure Redis Cache scaling feature is currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Azure Redis Cache scaling feature is currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache has different cache offerings which provide flexibility in the choice of cache size and features.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache has different cache offerings which provide flexibility in the choice of cache size and features.

trans-unit.source: If the requirements of your application change after a cache is created, you can scale the size of the cache using the **Change pricing tier** blade in the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: If the requirements of your application change after a cache is created, you can scale the size of the cache using the **Change pricing tier** blade in the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you scale an Azure Redis Cache you can change the size but you can't change from a Standard to a Basic cache and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you scale an Azure Redis Cache you can change the size but you can't change from a Standard to a Basic cache and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: When to scale
trans-unit.target: When to scale

trans-unit.source: You can use the [monitoring](cache-how-to-monitor.md) features of Azure Redis Cache to monitor the health and performance of your cache applications and to help determine if there is a need to scale the cache.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [monitoring](cache-how-to-monitor.md) features of Azure Redis Cache to monitor the health and performance of your cache applications and to help determine if there is a need to scale the cache.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the following metrics to help determine if you need to scale.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the following metrics to help determine if you need to scale.

trans-unit.source: Redis Server Load
trans-unit.target: Redis Server Load

trans-unit.source: Memory Usage
trans-unit.target: Memory Usage

trans-unit.source: Network Bandwidth
trans-unit.target: Network Bandwidth

trans-unit.source: CPU Usage
trans-unit.target: CPU Usage

trans-unit.source: If you determine that your cache is no longer meeting the requirements of your application, you can change to a larger or smaller cache pricing tier that is right for your application.
trans-unit.target: If you determine that your cache is no longer meeting the requirements of your application, you can change to a larger or smaller cache pricing tier that is right for your application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on determining which cache pricing tier to use, see [What Redis Cache offering and size should I use](cache-faq.md#what-redis-cache-offering-and-size-should-i-use).
trans-unit.target: For more information on determining which cache pricing tier to use, see [What Redis Cache offering and size should I use](cache-faq.md#what-redis-cache-offering-and-size-should-i-use).

trans-unit.source: Scale a cache
trans-unit.target: Scale a cache

trans-unit.source: To scale your cache, [browse to the cache](cache-configure.md#configure-redis-cache-settings) in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) and click the **Standard tier** or **Basic tier** part in the **Redis Cache** blade.
trans-unit.target: To scale your cache, [browse to the cache](cache-configure.md#configure-redis-cache-settings) in the [preview portal](https://portal.azure.com) and click the **Standard tier** or **Basic tier** part in the **Redis Cache** blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Pricing tier][redis-cache-pricing-tier-part]
trans-unit.target: ![Pricing tier][redis-cache-pricing-tier-part]

trans-unit.source: Select the desired pricing tier from the **Pricing tier** blade and click **Select**.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired pricing tier from the **Pricing tier** blade and click **Select**.

trans-unit.source: ![Pricing tier][redis-cache-pricing-tier-blade]
trans-unit.target: ![Pricing tier][redis-cache-pricing-tier-blade]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Caches can't change plans from Basic to Standard or vice versa, and you can't scale down to a 250MB cache from one of the larger sizes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Caches can't change plans from Basic to Standard or vice versa, and you can't scale down to a 250MB cache from one of the larger sizes.

trans-unit.source: You can scale up from a 250MB cache to a larger size, but you will not be able to scale back down to the 250 MB pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: You can scale up from a 250MB cache to a larger size, but you will not be able to scale back down to the 250 MB pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: If you need to change from Basic to Standard or scale down to the 250 MB size you must create a new cache.
trans-unit.target: If you need to change from Basic to Standard or scale down to the 250 MB size you must create a new cache.

trans-unit.source: While the cache is scaling to the new pricing tier, a **Scaling** status is displayed in the **Redis Cache** blade.
trans-unit.target: While the cache is scaling to the new pricing tier, a **Scaling** status is displayed in the **Redis Cache** blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Scaling][redis-cache-scaling]
trans-unit.target: ![Scaling][redis-cache-scaling]

trans-unit.source: When scaling is complete, the status changes from **Scaling** to **Running**.
trans-unit.target: When scaling is complete, the status changes from **Scaling** to **Running**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] During scaling operations, Basic caches are offline and all data in the cache is lost.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] During scaling operations, Basic caches are offline and all data in the cache is lost.

trans-unit.source: Once the scaling operation completes, the Basic cache will be back online, with no data.
trans-unit.target: Once the scaling operation completes, the Basic cache will be back online, with no data.

trans-unit.source: Standard caches remain online during a scaling operation, and no data is typically lost when scaling a Standard cache to a larger size.
trans-unit.target: Standard caches remain online during a scaling operation, and no data is typically lost when scaling a Standard cache to a larger size.

trans-unit.source: When scaling a Standard cache to a smaller size, some data may be lost if the new size is smaller than the amount of cached data.
trans-unit.target: When scaling a Standard cache to a smaller size, some data may be lost if the new size is smaller than the amount of cached data.

trans-unit.source: If data is lost when scaling down, keys are evicted using the [allkeys-lru](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache) eviction policy.
trans-unit.target: If data is lost when scaling down, keys are evicted using the [allkeys-lru](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache) eviction policy.

trans-unit.source: Note that while Standard caches have a 99.9% SLA for availability, there is no SLA for data loss.
trans-unit.target: Note that while Standard caches have a 99.9% SLA for availability, there is no SLA for data loss.

trans-unit.source: How to automate a scaling operation
trans-unit.target: How to automate a scaling operation

trans-unit.source: In addition to scaling your Azure Redis Cache instance in the preview portal you can scale using the [Microsoft Azure Management Libraries (MAML)](http://azure.microsoft.com/updates/management-libraries-for-net-release-announcement/).
trans-unit.target: In addition to scaling your Azure Redis Cache instance in the preview portal you can scale using the [Microsoft Azure Management Libraries (MAML)](http://azure.microsoft.com/updates/management-libraries-for-net-release-announcement/).

trans-unit.source: To scale your cache, call the `IRedisOperations.CreateOrUpdate` method and pass in the new size for the `RedisProperties.SKU.Capacity`.
trans-unit.target: To scale your cache, call the `IRedisOperations.CreateOrUpdate` method and pass in the new size for the `RedisProperties.SKU.Capacity`.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Manage Redis Cache using MAML](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/ManageCacheUsingMAML) sample.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Manage Redis Cache using MAML](https://github.com/rustd/RedisSamples/tree/master/ManageCacheUsingMAML) sample.

trans-unit.source: Scaling FAQ
trans-unit.target: Scaling FAQ

trans-unit.source: The following list contains answers to commonly asked questions about Azure Redis Cache scaling.
trans-unit.target: The following list contains answers to commonly asked questions about Azure Redis Cache scaling.

trans-unit.source: After scaling, do I have to change my cache name or access keys
trans-unit.target: After scaling, do I have to change my cache name or access keys

trans-unit.source: No, your cache name and keys are unchanged during a scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: No, your cache name and keys are unchanged during a scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: How does scaling work
trans-unit.target: How does scaling work

trans-unit.source: When a **Basic** cache is scaled, it is shut down and a new cache is provisioned using the new size.
trans-unit.target: When a **Basic** cache is scaled, it is shut down and a new cache is provisioned using the new size.

trans-unit.source: During this time, the cache is unavailable and all data in the cache is lost.
trans-unit.target: During this time, the cache is unavailable and all data in the cache is lost.

trans-unit.source: When a **Standard** cache is scaled, one of the replicas is shut down and re-provisioned to the new size and the data transferred over, and then the other replica performs a failover before it is reprovisioned, similar to the process that occurs during a failure of one of the cache nodes.
trans-unit.target: When a **Standard** cache is scaled, one of the replicas is shut down and re-provisioned to the new size and the data transferred over, and then the other replica performs a failover before it is reprovisioned, similar to the process that occurs during a failure of one of the cache nodes.

trans-unit.source: Will I lose data from my cache during scaling
trans-unit.target: Will I lose data from my cache during scaling

trans-unit.source: When a **Basic** cache is scaled, all data is lost and the cache is unavailable during the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: When a **Basic** cache is scaled, all data is lost and the cache is unavailable during the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: When a **Standard** cache is scaled to a larger size, all data is usually preserved.
trans-unit.target: When a **Standard** cache is scaled to a larger size, all data is usually preserved.

trans-unit.source: When scaling a **Standard** cache down to a smaller size, data may be lost depending on how much data is in the cache related to the new size when it is scaled.
trans-unit.target: When scaling a **Standard** cache down to a smaller size, data may be lost depending on how much data is in the cache related to the new size when it is scaled.

trans-unit.source: If data is lost when scaling down, keys are evicted using the [allkeys-lru](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache) eviction policy.
trans-unit.target: If data is lost when scaling down, keys are evicted using the [allkeys-lru](http://redis.io/topics/lru-cache) eviction policy.

trans-unit.source: Note that while Standard caches have a 99.9% SLA for availability, there is no SLA for data loss.
trans-unit.target: Note that while Standard caches have a 99.9% SLA for availability, there is no SLA for data loss.

trans-unit.source: Will my cache be available during scaling
trans-unit.target: Will my cache be available during scaling

trans-unit.source: **Standard** caches remain available during the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: **Standard** caches remain available during the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: **Basic** caches are offline during the scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: **Basic** caches are offline during the scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: Operations that are not supported
trans-unit.target: Operations that are not supported

trans-unit.source: You can't change from a **Basic** to a **Standard** cache or vice versa during a scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: You can't change from a **Basic** to a **Standard** cache or vice versa during a scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: You can scale up from a **C0** (250 MB) cache to a larger size, but you can't scale a larger size down to a **C0** cache.
trans-unit.target: You can scale up from a **C0** (250 MB) cache to a larger size, but you can't scale a larger size down to a **C0** cache.

trans-unit.source: If a scaling operation fails, the service will try to revert the operation and the cache will revert to the original size.
trans-unit.target: If a scaling operation fails, the service will try to revert the operation and the cache will revert to the original size.

trans-unit.source: How long does scaling take
trans-unit.target: How long does scaling take

trans-unit.source: Scaling takes approximately 20 minutes, depending on how much data is in the cache.
trans-unit.target: Scaling takes approximately 20 minutes, depending on how much data is in the cache.

trans-unit.source: How can I tell when scaling is complete
trans-unit.target: How can I tell when scaling is complete

trans-unit.source: In the preview portal you can see the scaling operation in progress.
trans-unit.target: In the preview portal you can see the scaling operation in progress.

trans-unit.source: When scaling is complete, the status of the cache changes to **Running**.
trans-unit.target: When scaling is complete, the status of the cache changes to **Running**.

trans-unit.source: Why is this feature in preview
trans-unit.target: Why is this feature in preview

trans-unit.source: We are releasing this feature to get feedback.
trans-unit.target: We are releasing this feature to get feedback.

trans-unit.source: Based on the feedback, we will release this feature to General Availability soon.
trans-unit.target: Based on the feedback, we will release this feature to General Availability soon.
